title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: install package, start R enter (un-commented): now load packages needed current vignette:
code: # if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) #     install.packages("devtools") #  # devtools::install_github(repo = 'https://github.com/UCLouvain-CBIO/MDSgui') suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(HDCytoData)) library(CytoMDS) library(MDSgui)

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSgui package implements visualization Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection cytometry samples. objects can obtained using functionalities implemented CytoMDS package (Hauchamps et al. (2024)). information see CytoMDS vignette. visualization realised via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters (see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function details parameters).

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: load illustrative mass cytometry (CyTOF) dataset (Bodenmiller et al. 2012), provided Bioconductor HDCytoData data package (Weber Soneson (2019)). information see CytoMDS vignette.
code: BCRXL_fs <- HDCytoData::Bodenmiller_BCR_XL_flowSet() ## see ?HDCytoData and browseVignettes('HDCytoData') for documentation ## loading from cache ## Warning in updateObjectFromSlots(object, ..., verbose = verbose): dropping ## slot(s) 'colnames' from object = 'flowSet' BCRXL_fs ## A flowSet with 16 experiments. ##  ## column names(39): Time Cell_length ... sample_id population_id

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: Next compute phenodata dataframe experimental design information, MDS projection dataset well list sample statistics. detailed description step see CytoMDS vignette. save newly created objects .rds files. files can selected within shiny app visualization.
code: phenoData <- flowCore::pData(BCRXL_fs) additionalPhenoData <-      keyword(BCRXL_fs[[1]], "EXPERIMENT_INFO")$EXPERIMENT_INFO phenoData <- cbind(phenoData, additionalPhenoData)  flowCore::pData(BCRXL_fs) <- phenoData # Select markers markerInfo <- keyword(BCRXL_fs[[1]], "MARKER_INFO")$MARKER_INFO chClass <- markerInfo$marker_class  chLabels <- markerInfo$channel_name[chClass != "none"] (chMarkers <- markerInfo$marker_name[chClass != "none"]) ##  [1] "CD3"    "CD45"   "pNFkB"  "pp38"   "CD4"    "CD20"   "CD33"   "pStat5" ##  [9] "CD123"  "pAkt"   "pStat1" "pSHP2"  "pZap70" "pStat3" "CD14"   "pSlp76" ## [17] "pBtk"   "pPlcg2" "pErk"   "pLat"   "IgM"    "pS6"    "HLA-DR" "CD7" # arcsinh() transformation trans <- arcsinhTransform(     transformationId="ArcsinhTransform",      a = 0,      b = 1/5,      c = 0)  # Scale transforming the raw data BCRXL_fs_trans <- transform(     BCRXL_fs,     transformList(chLabels, trans))  # Calculating distances between samples pwDist <- pairwiseEMDDist(     BCRXL_fs_trans,     channels = chMarkers,     verbose = FALSE )  # Computing the MDS projection mdsObj <- computeMetricMDS(pwDist, seed = 0) show(mdsObj) ## MDS object containing MDS projection (using Smacof algorithm)  data: ## Nb of dimensions:  4  ## Nb of points:  16  ## Stress:  0.040668  ## Pseudo RSquare:  0.981489  ## Goodness of fit:  0.998346 # Computiong sample statistics statFUNs = c("median" = stats::median,              "Q25" = function(x, na.rm) {                  stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.25)              },              "Q75" = function(x, na.rm) {                  stats::quantile(x, probs = 0.75)              },              "standard deviation" = stats::sd) chStats <- channelSummaryStats(BCRXL_fs_trans,                                channels = chLabels,                                 statFUNs = statFUNs) saveRDS(mdsObj, file = "mdsObj.rds") saveRDS(phenoData, file = "phenoData.rds") saveRDS(chStats, file = "chStats.rds")

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: MDSgui function run_app launches interactive Shiny app three tabs window figure gets opened. ‘Input files’ tab objects can loaded visualization. plots shown ‘View’ tab ‘General settings’ contains technical plot settings controls. input files expected .rds extension least file containing MDS object loaded. Optionally phenodata file containing phenodata dataframe /file containing list statistics biplot visualization can loaded. can select previously created files proceed visualization. Note phenodata file selected new control appears allowing select subset variables (default selected). phenodata selected variables ones available drop-list controls ‘View’ tab. can now open ‘View’ tab see plot projection results. controls side allow choose projection axes, colour, label, shape points according phenodata variables, add biplot, show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes. example can colour points according group_id label points according patient_id shown figure . can also add biplot created based sample statistics clicking biplot checkbox. idea calculate correlation sample statistics w.r.t. axes projection, correlations can represented correlation circle overlaid projection plot. desired statistic can selected drop menu possible show arrows respect selected length threshold. example , chosen statistic median arrow length threshold 0.8.  Finally possible display interactive plotly plot regular one selecting corresponding checkbox. can also add new plotly tooltips highlight corresponding information point hovering .

title: Visualization of Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects
text: completeness show ‘General settings’ tab contains general controls regarding e.g. points features, corresponding labels biplot arrows. details see CytoMDS::ggplotSampleMDS() function parameters.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: MDSgui package implements visualization Multi Dimensional Scaling (MDS) objects representing low dimensional projection cytometry samples. objects can obtained using functionalities implemented CytoMDS package. visualization realised via Shiny app allows user interactively customise plots depending series input parameters. screenshot app ‘View’ tab. controls side allow choose projection axes, colour, label, shape points according phenodata variables, add biplot, show plotly plot interactive plot exploration flip axes.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: MDSgui code provided GPL license version 3.0 higher. documentation, including manual pages vignettes, distributed CC -SA 4.0 license.

title: Plots of MDS results
text: use MDSgui research, please use following citation: Hauchamps, Philippe, Simon Delandre, Stephane T. Temmerman, Dan Lin, Laurent Gatto. 2024. “Visual Quality Control CytoMDS, Bioconductor Package Low Dimensional Representation Cytometry Sample Distances.” bioRxiv. https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.07.01.601465.
